workingLeft: None if all the animals of Chapter 1 are wholly obtained in the country or territory
Manufacture in which all the meat and edible meat offal in the goods of this Chapter is wholly obtained in the country or territory

description: Fish and crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic invertebrates, except for:
workingLeft: None if the fish and crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic invertebrates are wholly obtained in the country or territory

description: Fish fillets and other fish meat (whether or not minced), fresh, chilled of frozen
workingLeft: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained in the country or territory

description: Fish, dried, salted or in brine; smoked fish, whether or not cooked before or during the smoking process; flours, meals and pellets of fish, fit for human consumption
workingLeft: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained in the country or territory

description: Crustaceans, whether in shell or not, dried, salted or in brine; crustaceans, in shell, cooked by steaming or by boiling in water, whether or not chilled, frozen, dried, salted or in brine; flours, meals and pellets of crustaceans, fit for human consumption
workingLeft: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained in the country or territory

description: Molluscs, whether in shell or not, dried, salted or in brine; aquatic invertebrates other than crustaceans and molluscs, dried, salted or in brine; flours, meals and pellets of aquatic invertebrates other than crustaceans, fit for human consumption
workingLeft: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained in the country or territory

footnotes.note: See Note 2.2 in Part 1 of this Schedule.
For the special conditions relating to “specific processes”, see Notes 6.1 and 6.3 in Part 1 of this Schedule.
For the special conditions relating to “specific processes”, see Note 6.2 in Part 1 of this Schedule.
A “group” is regarded as any part of the heading separated from the rest by a semi-colon.

In the case of the goods composed of materials classified within both headings 3901 to 3906, on the one hand, and within headings 3907 to 3911, on the other hand, this restriction only applies to that group of materials which predominates by weight in the good.
The following foils are to be considered as highly transparent: foils, the optical dimming of which, measured according to ASTM-D 1003-16() by Gardner Hazemeter (i.e. Hazefactor), is less than 2%.
For special conditions relating to goods made of a mixture of textile materials, see Note 4 in Part 1 of this Schedule.
The use of this material is restricted to the manufacture of woven fabrics of a kind used in paper-making machinery.
